title: Ticket #6787: Default value for DEFAULT_JOB_MAX_RETRIES too high
description:
I believe that the default value of 10 for DEFAULT_JOB_MAX_RETRIES is too high. Obviously you may disagree and you should feel free to mark this ticket resolved. The case I'm worried about is that a user intentionally or via cut-and-paste sets success_exit_code in his/her submit command. Doesn't matter the value, just that it is explicitly set, rather than defaulting to 0.

The user may be doing this in order to define the condition for job failure and get a consequent notification.

Regardless of the notifications settings, such a job will be retried 10 times with the "out of the box" configuration. This is almost certainly wasted cycles. "Fool me once" and all that.

If the user does want a notification, this is almost certainly not the behavior they desire because notifications (appear to be) are generated when the job exits the queue. In this instance, the user won't get a notification until the job has failed 10+1=11 times.

A default value of 0 or 1 seems more appropriate.
remarks:
2018-Oct-02 14:54:43 by jfrey:
Todd Tannenbaum and I think 3 is a better default than 10.

2018-Oct-02 14:55:40 by tpdownes:
SGTM.

2018-Oct-03 12:36:15 by tim:
After discussion with the Research Computing Facilitators, we have decided to change this to 2 retries (3 total attempts).

2018-Oct-03 12:38:18 by tpdownes:
Not to poke the bear, but shouldn't the knob really be JOB_DEFAULT_MAX_RETRIES?
